climbs.name: Reprise de La Bastille
climbs.fa: FRA: Robert R. Fenichel & David M. Coffey, Fall 1993

content.description: A fantastic beginner lead. Start at the center of the slab, under the prominent right-facing flake. Move up slabby blocks to gain the flake, then follow the flake. After the flake, the terrain drops down to ~4th class. Great views from the top.
content.protection: On lead, gear up to 3" will keep you happy. At the top, there are small trees for anchors, or cracks up to ~2".
content.location: Follows the prominent right-leaning/facing flake system that sits at the center of the slab.

content.description: Start right of Reprise de la Bastille on a Â low angle face. Climb up the path of least resistance going left past a roof. You'll join up with Reprise de la Bastille close to the top of the climb.
content.protection: Small trees and a gear up to 2" for a top rope anchor

content.description: This face is at the western base of westview overlooks, and thus gets afternoon sun. Relatively secluded area, with a few easy-moderate routes. On this face, the "real" climbing ends after ~50 feet, but you can continue on 3rd/2nd class terrain to Westview Overlook. The easiest way to return to the base of the slab from the top is to take a 2nd class "trail" which hugs the slab on the climber's left side.
